data.content:
Company Headquarters: Soumagne, Liège

Founded: 1968

Workforce: ~ 200 employees

Primary Industry: Manufacture of machinery and equipment for agriculture

Company Working:

Since its founding in 1968 by Victor Joskin as an agricultural contractor, JOSKIN has expanded its operations, establishing its Soumagne site in 1972 and adding retail and repair of agricultural equipment by 1973. Import activities began in 1974, leading to the formation of Société Anonyme Ets. JOSKIN in 1983. The company launched its first slurry spreader in 1984 and expanded with SCIMASA in 1988, a site in Trzcianka in 1999, and a Bourges factory in 2002. SPAW TECH was founded in Andrimont in 2007. In 2013, JOSKIN acquired Leboulch, and in 2022, announced plans for a new factory in Esch-sur-Alzette, Luxembourg

dataStore.Development: The "Zielone Agro Show 2024" took place on May 18-19 at the Moto-Park airfield in Ułęż, Poland, showcasing cutting-edge silage equipment and slurry tankers for dairy cattle breeders. The event featured 160 exhibitors and attracted 30,000 visitors, with highlights including field demonstrations of 40 tractor-machine combinations and notable interest in JOSKIN machines. Favourable weather contributed to the success of this year's show, marking it as a significant event for the agricultural community.

The construction of the new JOSKIN ESA factory in Luxembourg, initially delayed by permit issues, is now progressing smoothly and is set to be operational by the third quarter of 2025. The facility will enhance production of large tipping trailers and muck spreaders.

La Vieille-Lyre is expanding with a new 6,000 m² building to boost production capacity by 40%, aiming to double annual output of Leboulch tipping trailers and muck spreaders. The project is set for completion by the end of 2024.

The Bednary trade show featured 694 exhibitors and over 80,000 visitors, with significant interest from young farmers and discussions on advanced slurry spreading methods and environmental schemes like ECO-SCHEMES. Joskin showcased 37 machines, including new models like the 28-t Ferti-SPACE2 HORIZON H8014/28TR muck spreader and the 26,000-l Tetraliner ADTL26000V/3-22 slurry tanker, reinforcing their market presence in Poland and generating positive sales impacts.

Opolagra 2023, held from 16th to 18th June at Kamień Śląski airport, showcased agricultural machinery and products amid strong visitor turnouts. JOSKIN featured three machines, including popular Modulo2 tankers and the versatile Ferti-Space 6511BU Horizon muck spreader, reflecting interest in eco-schemes and cost-effective farming amid industry challenges.

The Zielone Agro Show 2023 highlighted dairy equipment and silage machines, drawing 30,000 visitors and featuring 50 tractor-machine demonstrations. JOSKIN's ADV18000V/2-22 Volumetra and ADV20000/1-21 slurry tanker showcased technical innovations, aligning with Green Pact policies and reflecting strong business opportunities in dairy farming technologies.

data.content: Joskin not only manufactures agricultural machinery but also provides comprehensive support throughout the lifecycle of their products. They offer expert consultation during the design phase to recommend efficient systems compliant with regulations. Their installation process includes training and optimizing equipment integration. Joskin provides tailored preventative maintenance plans with delegated tasks post-training. Complex maintenance and safety systems undergo annual service and functionality checks by SCIMA technicians. They offer remote support for issue diagnosis, reducing onsite visits. Skilled technicians prioritize onsite repairs and maintain a stocked inventory of spare parts for quick delivery. Joskin ensures reliable and safe operation through their commitment to selling spare parts and servicing agricultural machinery

value.name: Bavaria Yachts boasts a powerful brand reputation. Bavaria Yachts is a well-established company with a reputation for quality and innovation (evident in awards like "European Yacht of the Year" and nominations for various other awards).

Bavaria Yachts has a lineup of well-regarded sailing and motor yachts. Their C-Line and SR-Line yachts are popular for features like spacious interiors, focus on comfort, performance, innovative design, and focus on deck space for socializing

Their success might be tied to the performance of boat shows, which can be impacted by external factors. Bavaria Yachts' success is linked to their performance at boat shows, which serve as crucial marketing and sales platforms. These events can be affected by external factors such as economic downturns, unfavorable weather conditions, or global crises like pandemics. Consequently, any disruption in boat show attendance or success can directly impact Bavaria Yachts' sales and brand visibility

The discontinuation of the VISION 42 line might indicate challenges in adapting to dealer or customer preferences. The discontinuation of the VISION 42 line could suggest that Bavaria Yachts is facing difficulties in aligning their product offerings with dealer and customer preferences. This may indicate a gap in market research or responsiveness to consumer demands. As a result, it could lead to a loss of customer loyalty and a decline in market share. Additionally, it might signal internal challenges in product development and innovation

The "BAVARIA Yacht Configurator" suggests they're embracing digital tools to enhance customer experience. Bavaria Yachts ups its game with a digital yacht configurator!  This online tool lets customers personalize their dream yacht, boosting sales and customer satisfaction in a tech-driven market.

Opening a new sales office in China highlights an opportunity for further growth in the Asian market. Bavaria Yachts opens a China office to capture Asia's growing luxury yacht market. This local presence allows them to connect with customers, boost sales, and cater to their preferences

Strong competition from established players like Beneteau and Jeanneau could limit market share growth. Bavaria Yachts faces difficulty in established rivals like Beneteau and Jeanneau. These competitors boast strong brands, wide distribution networks, and loyal customers, making market share expansion tougher. Their constant innovation and marketing further crowd Bavaria Yachts' growth potential

Global supply chain disruptions could affect production or delivery timelines. Global supply chain problems threaten Bavaria Yachts. Material shortages, shipping delays, and political tensions could slow production and delivery. This could hurt customer satisfaction, their competitive edge, and ultimately, their profits

data.content:
Company Headquarters: Giebelstadt, Bayern

Founded: 1978

Workforce: ~ 2,300 employes

Primary Industry: Sailing Yachts, Motorboats, and Catamarans

Company Working:

For over four decades, Bavaria Yachts has established itself as a leader in marine innovation. From their headquarters in Giebelstadt, Germany, their team of experts leverages a rich heritage in boat construction with cutting-edge design and engineering. This focus on three pillars – deep knowledge, innovative engineering, and meticulous craftsmanship – distinguishes Bavaria Yachts. Their commitment to quality is evident in the meticulous selection of materials and the application of advanced techniques throughout the manufacturing process. The result: a portfolio of exceptional sailing yachts, motorboats, and catamarans, each meticulously crafted to deliver the ultimate yachting experience for the global recreational boating market

dataStore.Development: BAVARIA YACHTS is showcasing the all-new BAVARIA C46 yacht at the 2023 Yachting Festival in Cannes. This next-generation C-LINE model boasts innovative features and has been nominated for the prestigious 2024 European Yacht of the Year Award. The BAVARIA C46 occurs to be a well-rounded yacht designed to appeal to a wide range of sailors with its blend of comfort, performance, and innovative features.

Bavaria Yachts unveiled their new motor yacht, the BAVARIA SR33, at the 2023 boot show in Düsseldorf. This yacht prioritizes deck space for relaxation and socializing, with a well-equipped galley in the cockpit. It also offers a convertible sun lounger and an ergonomic helm station. Below deck, the open layout provides ample light and space for up to 6 people to sleep comfortably.

data.content: Bavaria Yachts leverages a branched approach to drive sales and market share. Product development is a key focus, with new models like the C46 and SR36 catering to specific customer needs and maintaining a fresh product portfolio. Their dedication to quality and innovation is reflected in awards like "European Yacht of the Year," further shaping their brand image. Bavaria Yachts has established a strong global presence through a network of dealers and participation in major boat shows. This allows them to showcase their yachts to a wide audience and connect with potential customers worldwide. Recognizing the growing Asian market, they've strategically opened a new sales office in China, demonstrating their commitment to expansion. Building customer loyalty is another pillar of their strategy. Bavaria Yachts prioritizes high-quality manufacturing and offers customer service initiatives like workshops, fostering trust and long-term relationships. Additionally, the introduction of the "BAVARIA Yacht Configurator" highlights their embrace of digital tools to enhance customer experience.  By focusing on product development, market expansion, and customer focus, Bavaria Yachts positions itself for continued success in the competitive yachting industry. There's always room for improvement, and areas like increased financial transparency and website optimization could further strengthen their brand and reach

value.name: Krones excels by offering comprehensive solutions covering the entire production line for beverages and liquid food
Diverse Beverage and Food Technology Solutions Expertise characterizes Krones' deep understanding of various beverage and food categories
Their focus on beverage and liquid food production makes them susceptible to downturns in those industries
The wide range of products and customization options might lead to complexities for smaller companies seeking simpler solutions
Expanding into growing markets and leveraging rising global consumption enhances growth opportunities
Integrating eco-friendly solutions and digital innovations boosts Krones' competitive edge and operational efficiency
Competition from established players
Economic downturns impacting sales

data.content:
Company Headquarters: Neutraubling, Bavaria

Founded: 1951

Workforce: ~ 10001 employes

Primary Industry: Krones operates in the packaging and bottling machinery industry.

Company Working:

Krones is a global leader in the packaging and bottling machinery industry. They design, manufacture, and install complete production lines for a wide range of beverages and food products. From brewing equipment and filtration systems to bottling, canning, labeling, and palletizing technologies, Krones offers a comprehensive solution for efficient and sustainable production processes. Their expertise extends beyond just beverage production, encompassing food and dairy, chemicals, pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, and both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverage sectors.

Krones attributes its success to several key strategies.  First, they combine extensive mechanical engineering knowledge with a deep understanding of their customers' specific needs across various industries. Second, a strong commitment to research and development ensures their technology remains cutting-edge, with over 7,050 patents granted and pending serving as a testament to their innovative spirit.  Third, Krones prioritizes exceptional quality by utilizing state-of-the-art equipment in their manufacturing facilities throughout Germany. Finally, a highly skilled workforce provides 24/7 global support, ensuring optimal performance of their clients' production lines wherever they operate.

Krones' global reach extends far beyond their German headquarters. With regional offices strategically located throughout the Americas, Europe, Asia-Pacific, the Middle East, and Africa, they are well-positioned to serve a diverse clientele. This global presence allows them to be a key partner for companies across various sectors, helping them achieve efficient and sustainable production of beverages and food products

dataStore.Development: In May, the company signed an agreement with SCS and Tomra to test a new recycling process for XPS food trays.
In April, the company signed an agreement to acquire a 45% stake in Perfinox - IndUstria MetalUrgica, S.A.
In April, the company announced its plans to introduce a new generation of dry containers, KRONE Dry Box, with ten enhancements.

data.content: Krones leverages a multi-pronged approach to drive growth and solidify its market position. Acquisitions are a key pillar of their strategy.  Examples like Ampco Pumps in the US and Netstal, a manufacturer of injection molding machines, demonstrate their focus on expanding their product portfolio and market reach.  This allows them to offer a wider range of solutions and cater to new customer segments like the medical/pharmaceutical, cosmetics, and food industries.  Furthermore, Krones is on track to surpass its initial financial targets set in 2021. They anticipate achieving their 2025 revenue target of €5 billion by 2024, a year ahead of schedule, and reaching their 2025 EBITDA margin target range as well. This strong financial performance is attributed to their talented workforce. Krones recognizes its employees' flexibility, creativity, and motivation as key drivers of success.  The company fosters a culture of innovation, aiming to deliver "Solutions beyond tomorrow" that exceed customer expectations.  Sustainability is another core value for Krones. Their vision focuses on providing "Sustainable and affordable beverages, food and essentials for everyone and everywhere," highlighting their commitment to long-term environmental responsibility. Krones' Supervisory Board kept a firm hand on strategy in 2023. They prioritized good governance, addressing a compliance lapse to maintain standards. Data security remained a focus, with updates on efforts to protect Krones' systems and products. Sustainability progress was reviewed, underlining their environmental and social goals.  Growth and global expansion were key, with plans to increase market reach presented. The board explored opportunities in digitalization and AI, looking to future-proof the company. Finally, risk management remained a priority, and the 2024 budget was approved, reflecting their focus on financial planning. These meetings showcase Krones' commitment to a well-rounded strategy for long-term success

value.name: New products like rotor systems and Optima Nozzles prove their commitment to cutting-edge maritime technology
Custom rudders for the German Navy and energy-efficient equipment for Chile showcase their ability to tailor offerings to specific client needs.
Focus on established regions like Europe and South America might limit growth in emerging high-demand markets
Lack of partnerships with local companies in new regions hinders expansion by making it difficult to navigate regulations and build relationships
Leveraging their diverse product range beyond government projects can propel them into commercial shipbuilding and repair
Strategic partnerships in maritime tech or shipyards can expand service offerings and market reach
Competitive government shipbuilding market can lead to tight margins due to price pressure.
Unpredictable government funding can cause delays or cancellations, impacting DMC's revenue stream

data.content:
Company Headquarters: Gorinchem, South Holland, Netherlands

Founded: 1927

Workforce: ~12500 employes

Primary Industry: Damen specializes in shipbuilding and ship repair.

Company Working:

Over 150 years, Damen Marine Components (DMC) has been a global leader in maritime components. They design and manufacture rudders, steering systems, winches, and more for all vessel types. DMC prioritizes efficiency with energy-saving solutions like low-drag rudders. They offer a variety of rudders, from high-speed solutions for large ships to maneuverable types for fishing boats. All rudders are meticulously designed and tested for exceptional performance.  DMC's steering systems, both simple and complex, are built for precision and reliability. Their winches are designed for tough jobs like anchoring and towing, trusted by maritime professionals worldwide. Damen Anchor and Chain Factory (AKF), a subsidiary of DMC, provides high-quality anchors and chains built to endure harsh conditions. With a vast stock available, they offer a diverse selection to meet each client's needs. DMC is a one-stop shop for all your vessel's core components. Their focus on innovation, quality, and efficiency makes them a valuable partner for maritime businesses worldwide

dataStore.Development: In June, the company introduced an offshore charging solution for fully electric crew transfer vessel (CTV).
In June, the company signed a contract with Portland Harbour Authority to deliver Damen ASD Tug 2111, one of its latest tugs.
In June, the company launched the fully electric Fast Crew Supplier (FCS) 3210 E.

Damen Marine Components (DMC) opened a new, state-of-the-art office in Hamburg, Germany. This move reflects their focus on sustainability and innovation, with the new space boasting eco-friendly features and a modern design.

Damen Marine Components provides custom-built rudders for the biggest ever Pure Car and Truck Carriers (ships for vehicles). These rudders will be especially efficient due to their design (Asymmetric Rudder Technology) and additional components (Silent Bulb) that reduce fuel consumption and noise.

Damen Marine Components provided a special rudder and steering gear system for a new Norwegian research vessel. Their Barke flap rudder offers excellent maneuverability, low noise, and fuel efficiency, ideal for research activities.

Damen Marine Components (DMC) successfully showcased their new "smart dock winches" during the controlled towage of the massive cruise ship Emerald Princess at the Damen Shiprepair Rotterdam dock. These winches were specifically designed for the dock, which is 405 meters long and 90 meters wide.

data.content: Damen Marine Components (DMC) has been continuously striving to solidify its position as a leader in the competitive maritime component industry.  One key strategy has been leveraging their diverse product range to target commercial shipbuilding and repair markets beyond government projects.  This focus on market diversification complements their commitment to sustainability.  DMC has been promoting existing energy-efficient solutions like the Optima Nozzle, while also continuously investing in R&D for new eco-friendly technologies to meet the growing green demands of the industry.  Furthermore, DMC has been embracing digitalization and automation to enhance both efficiency and the value proposition they offer clients.  Strategic partnerships with maritime technology companies or shipyards have also been a cornerstone of their growth strategy, allowing them to expand service offerings and access new markets.  To build trust with investors and partners, DMC has also been increasing transparency regarding their financials and internal operations.  Finally, they have been pursuing targeted regional expansion through partnerships with local companies, unlocking high-growth markets and ensuring their long-term, sustainable growth

value.name: Wärtsilä's broad portfolio of engines, propulsion systems, and emission abatement technologies positions them as a one-stop shop for customer decarbonization needs
Strong core business alignment with decarbonization trend positions Wärtsilä for growth, with a roadmap to a 12% operating margin demonstrating financial strength and strategic focus
Slow market adoption of decarbonization solutions due to external factors
The congested shipyards in China and South Korea could cause delays and price increases for new ships, potentially impacting Wärtsilä's sales of new equipment
The increasing customer interest in long-term service agreements presents a significant opportunity. Expanding these agreements can lead to recurring revenue and stronger customer relationships
Wärtsilä boasts a customer renewal rate of around 90% for service agreements, indicating high customer satisfaction and loyalty. This provides a strong base for future service growth
Uncertainty surrounding investments in new ship capacity and renewable energy infrastructure could limit Wärtsilä's market opportunities
If competitors develop and commercialize decarbonization technologies faster than Wärtsilä, they could lose their competitive edge

data.content:
Company Headquarters: Helsinki, Finland

Founded: 1834

Workforce: ~ 17 800 employes

Primary Industry:

·        Marine Industry

·        Energy Industry

Company Working:

Wärtsilä is a global leader in innovative technologies and lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. Their focus lies in creating sustainable solutions that improve both environmental and economic performance for their customers. With a workforce of over 17,800 spreads across 280 locations in 79 countries, Wärtsilä has a significant global presence. Innovation in sustainable technologies and services is a core principle. They aim to help customers reduce their environmental impact while maintaining economic viability.

The company operates in two main business areas:

Wärtsilä Energy: Provides solutions for the power sector, including flexible power plants, energy storage, and lifecycle services. Their engines are designed to run on sustainable fuels, promoting decarbonization.

Wärtsilä Marine: Offers a wide range of products and services for the marine industry, including engines, digital technologies, propulsion systems, and lifecycle services. Their focus is on efficiency, reliability, safety, and environmental performance for ships.

Wärtsilä Portfolio Business manages independent business units to improve performance and unlock value through strategic decisions like divestments. Overall, Wärtsilä positions itself as a key player in driving sustainable transformation within the marine and energy sectors. Their dedication to innovation, global reach, and focus on environmental responsibility solidify their leading position

dataStore.Development: Wärtsilä signed a six-year agreement with Nautica Ship Management to optimize the performance of exhaust gas cleaning systems on two of their feeder container vessels. This ensures compliance with environmental regulations and allows for remote monitoring and troubleshooting, minimizing downtime. Wärtsilä's expertise and lifecycle support will benefit Nautica by reducing costs and improving overall efficiency.

Wärtsilä, has introduced its latest innovation - the Wärtsilä 25 engine. This medium-speed 4-stroke engine is designed to be a game-changer for fishing vessels. The Wärtsilä 25 positions itself as a significant advancement in sustainable and efficient marine engine technology, catering to the evolving needs of the fishing industry.

Wärtsilä will supply methanol-fueled auxiliary engines for twelve new container vessels being built for COSCO Shipping Lines and Orient Overseas Container Line. This represents the largest methanol-fueled newbuild order in China's maritime sector to date. This deal positions Wärtsilä as a leader in decarbonization efforts within the maritime industry, with methanol seen as a promising sustainable fuel alternative.

Wärtsilä, has partnered with Elliott Bay Design Group (EBDG) to develop the CHAMP barge - a floating mobile power platform that uses methanol fuel. This collaboration aims to tackle port emissions in North America by providing a cost-effective solution for ships lacking access to shore power. This project aligns with the sustainability goals of many North American ports and demonstrates Wärtsilä and EBDG's commitment to providing practical solutions for a greener maritime industry.

data.content: Wartsila's. Wärtsilä's strategy, "The Wärtsilä Way", outlines their path towards becoming a leader in decarbonization for the marine and energy sectors. Here's a breakdown of their key focus areas: Shaping the Decarbonization of Marine and Energy reflects Wärtsilä's long-term ambition to be a key player in driving sustainable solutions for these industries. Wärtsilä emphasizes customer success by understanding their needs, providing reliable and efficient solutions, and fostering strong partnerships. They value attracting and developing high-performing teams while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and safety. Wärtsilä aims to achieve profitable growth by focusing on key areas like service offerings and decarbonization solutions

Company Headquarters: Maassluis, The Netherlands

Founded: 1948

Workforce: ~ 2,300 employes

Primary Industry: Agricultural Machinery

Company Working:

Lely is a frontrunner in the agricultural machinery space, particularly well-known for their advancements in dairy farming equipment. Their dedication to innovation is evident in their team of 2,300 employees and 3 R&D departments that tirelessly work on developing new technologies to improve dairy farm operations. With a focus on delivering the best possible results for their customers, Lely leverages its expertise across two production facilities to manufacture their solutions.  The company's commitment to research and development is further underscored by their impressive portfolio of over 1,500 patents for their inventions. This dedication to innovation translates to tangible results, with Lely's solutions being used by dairy farmers in over 50 countries around the world.  The reach and success of their approach are reflected in their revenue of €704 million

dataStore.Development: Lely partnered with Acorn to offset their CO2 emissions in 2023 (7,200 tons) and aims to be CO2 neutral by 2030. Lely buys Carbon Removal Units (CRUs) from Acorn, which removes CO2 from the atmosphere through trees planted by small-scale farmers. This collaboration benefits both Lely (achieving CO2 neutrality) and farmers (additional income and promoting sustainable agriculture). Lely sees this as a step towards their vision of a sustainable dairy farming sector.

Lely, partnered with Konrad Pumpe, a plant engineering company, to offer more flexibility in automatic feeding systems for farms. The partnership allows Lely to add Konrad Pumpe's dosing systems to their feeding systems, enabling more precise and efficient feed distribution for farms with large herds. This alliance will benefit both companies: Lely can expand their product offerings and Konrad Pumpe can reach a wider market.

Lely launched a new udder care spray, Lely Quaress Fovum, for dairy farms. It disinfects and improves teat skin condition, which is crucial for udder health. The product contains ingredients that hydrate and regenerate teat skin, keeping it healthy and protecting cows from bacteria.

A new, improved Lely Orbiter milk processing system is now being used by a farmer in Netherlands. This system allows farmers to bottle and sell their milk directly, under their own brand "Mijn Melk". Consumers are increasingly interested in locally produced and fresh dairy products. This system benefits both farmers and consumers.

Lely released a new generation of Lely Juno, an automatic feed pusher for dairy farms. The new Juno focuses on reducing running costs for farmers with features like improved wheels and easier serviceability. This allows for more frequent feed pushing which benefits cow health, production and reduces wasted feed. Overall, the new Lely Juno helps farms save money and be more productive.

Lely, a dairy automation company, unveiled its new North American business complex, Lely Park, in Pella, Iowa. This investment aims to create a sustainable future in farming and meet the growing needs of North American farmers. Lely Park will serve as a hub for innovation and collaboration, focusing on developing solutions for the next generation of dairy farmers.

data.content: Lely's vision hinges on three key strategies. Initially, sustainability is a major focus, with the company committed to developing long-lasting products that minimize environmental impact. This includes energy-efficient technologies that reduce operational costs for farms while being kind to the planet. Furthermore, Lely prioritizes farm profitability. By creating innovative products and services that improve traditional farming practices, they aim to empower farmers with cost savings and increased efficiency, ultimately boosting their bottom line. Finally, user-centric design is paramount. Lely strives to develop reliable, well-designed products that are easy to operate, ensuring a pleasurable user experience for both farmers and contractors
